anchor.surface_text: Rule 1728 of Discipline and Appeal Rules for Gazetted Officers  Indian Railway Establishment Code Vol.I  reads as follows 1728. The following penalties may, for good and sufficient reasons and as hereinafter provided, be imposed upon members of the Railway Services, Classes I and II, namely Censure. Withholding of increments or promotion, including stoppage at any efficiency bar. Reduction to a lower post or time- scale or to a lower stage in a time-scale. Recovery from pay of the whole or part of any pecuniary loss caused to Government by negligence or breach of orders. Suspension. Removal from the civil service of the Government which does number disqualify from future employment. Dismissal from the civil service of the Government which ordinarily disqualifies from future employment.

issues.text: whether the appellant was, at the date of the complaint i.e., March 14, 1961, a public servant who was not removable from his office save by or with the sanction of the Central Government within the meaning of s. 197 of the Criminal Procedure Code and, therefore, whether sanction of Central Government was necessary for prosecuting the appellant of the offences under ss. 166 and 167 of the Indian Penal Code

whether even if the Railway Board had power to remove the appellant from his office and even if it was acting under the powers delegated to it, the principle of the maxim qui facit per alium facit per se applies to the case and the appellant must be deemed to be removable only by or with the sanction of the Central Government within the meaning of s. 197 of the Criminal Procedure Code

arguments.claim: Railway Board separate from Central Govt, exercises delegated powers per s.2 Indian Railway Board Act
Post-delegation of removal power, s.197 sanction by Central Govt not required; follows Afzalur Rahman precedent

holdings.text: the appellant was removable from his office with the sanction of the Railway Board and the sanction of the President is not necessary for taking such action against the appellant

anchor.surface_text: It is also apparent that a Railway Officer who merely officiates in Class I cannot be said to belong to Class I within the meaning of item I of Sch. II. It follows therefore that the appellant was removable from his office with the sanction of the Railway Board and the sanction of the President is not necessary for taking such action against the appellant.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Appellant substantive Class II officer officiating in Class I does not 'belong to' Class I per Sch. II to Rule 1729; first appointments/promotions to Class I by President but officiating by General Manager/Railway Board per IREC Rules 124, 132, 134

holdings.text: It cannot be said in the circumstances that the appellant was one of those public officers who could be removed only by or with the sanction of the Central Government within the meaning of s. 197, Criminal Procedure Code
holdings.reasoning_summary: Combined railway service rules and separation of Railway Board from Central Government lead to no s.197 sanction required for prosecution under ss.166/167 IPC

holdings.text: the Railway Board is an entity which is separate from the Central Government and the powers of the Railway Board are derived as a matter of delegation either absolutely or subject to conditions by notification by the Central Government
holdings.reasoning_summary: Railway Board exercises delegated powers under s.2 Indian Railway Board Act 1905, not part of Central Government despite Allocation of Business Rules and Indian Railway General Code

holdings.text: If once the Central Government has delegated its power to another authority with regard to appointment and removal of a public servant, then for the purpose of s. 197, Criminal Procedure Code the public servant concerned will not be treated to be a public servant not removable from his office except by or with the sanction of the Central Government
holdings.reasoning_summary: Delegation transfers authority for s.197 purposes; maxim qui facit per alium facit per se does not apply post-delegation; follows Afzalur Rahman v. King Emperor

precedents.citation: Afzalur Rahman v. The King Emperor etc.  1

anchor.surface_text: Afzalur Rahman v. The King Emperor etc.  1  in which it was held that a police officer who companyld be dismissed by the Deputy Inspector-General of Police under the statutory rules and regulations was number a person in number removable from office except by or with the sanction of the Provincial Government within the meaning of s. 197 of the Criminal Procedure Code and that sanction under that section was number, therefore, necessary for prosecuting such an officer for an offence alleged to have been companymitted by him.

precedents.case_name: Afzalur Rahman v. The King Emperor
precedents.cited_proposition: a police officer who companyld be dismissed by the Deputy Inspector-General of Police under the statutory rules and regulations was number a person in number removable from office except by or with the sanction of the Provincial Government within the meaning of s. 197 of the Criminal Procedure Code and that sanction under that section was number, therefore, necessary for prosecuting such an officer for an offence alleged to have been companymitted by him
precedents.cited_holding: a police officer who companyld be dismissed by the Deputy Inspector-General of Police under the statutory rules and regulations was number a person in number removable from office except by or with the sanction of the Provincial Government within the meaning of s. 197 of the Criminal Procedure Code and sanction under that section was number necessary

anchor.surface_text: It follows therefore that the appellant was removable from his office with the sanction of the Railway Board and the sanction of the President is number necessary for taking such action against the appellant.

outcome.relief_summary: No sanction under s. 197 CrPC required as appellant was removable by Railway Board, not Central Government; prosecution under ss. 166, 167 IPC directed to proceed as per High Court order
